title: Black screen during game play (Nvidia GPU)
body:
Hey everyone, 

The problem:

i recently had a problem with league of legends where i would get through champion select, through the loading screen and into the game. after about 20-30 seconds into the game my GPU fan would speed up like crazy and then i would get a black screen in which i would need to hard reset my comp to get functioning again (which it had no errors or anything on reboot). i tried numerous things to get this to go away from giving administration rights to ALOT of files/folders/apps and also updating many drivers etc. still no luck.

Whats Weird:

after my previous computer had its motherboard crap out on me. i went and purchased a new comp and transferred my power supply and video card into the new comp. i knew that none of my hardware was underpowered for league of legends because everything on paper exceeded lowest/recommended requirements and my old version of this set up (which was a weaker processor and ddr3 ram instead of ddr2)

The Solution:

after some research i read up that nvidia graphics cards (me having a geforce 8600GT) can sometimes be overclocked for certain situations, league being one of them, and all i had to do was go into an overclocking tool (i used nvidia's standard gpu controller) and turned my shadow clock down to the 1000-1060 range. Now my game runs smoothly with no problems and my video card never gets the that crazy high fan speed.

I hope this helps anyone who experienced my problem. It was a 3 day hastle that almost had me return the comp.
